page.title: 14Monuments in Calbourne
page.content: A{HORSE DRINKING TROUGH}near the east wall of the Sun Inn is dedicated to the memory of Sir Barrington Simeon who died in 1909. Now it is used to grow flowers. The{VILLAGE PUMP}had its roof restored to celebrate the Silver Jubilee of Elizabeth 2nd in 1977. This is opposite the entrance to School Lane and is no longer used as a water supply. The{WAR MEMORIAL}was erected in 1920 on the village green south of the church to remember those who died in the Great War from l914 to l918 and later names of the dead of the war from 1939 to 1945 were added. The{LONGSTONE}on the Down north of Mottistone Church is believed to be the oldest of man's constructions in the Isle of Wight, it is also known as the Speakers Stone.
